properties.areaDesc: Orange; Wake; Moore; Durham; Chatham; Alamance; Lee
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 14 at 2:08AM EST by NWS Raleigh NC
properties.description:
At 201 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of showers and
strong thunderstorms over western Chatham and eastern Randolph
Counties, moving northeast at 40 mph.

Wind gusts up to 40 mph will be possible with the strongest
thunderstorms. In addition, heavy rain with rainfall rates in excess
of a half inch per hour and minor flooding will also be possible
with these showers and thunderstorms.

Locations impacted include...
Raleigh, Durham, Cary, Chapel Hill, Sanford, Hillsborough, Pittsboro,
Siler City, Garner and Carrboro.
properties.instruction:
Wind gusts as high as 40 mph are capable of knocking down tree limbs
and blowing around trash cans, lawn furniture and other light
outdoor objects.

Locally heavy rain will quickly reduce visibility and result in an
accumulation water on roadways, standing water in low lying areas,
and minor flooding of creeks, streams, and areas of poor drainage.
Drivers are urged to slow down and use extra caution to avoid
hydroplaning.

NWSheadline: AN AREA OF SHOWERS AND EMBEDDED STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN ALAMANCE...NORTH CENTRAL MOORE...SOUTHEASTERN ORANGE... LEE...WESTERN WAKE...CHATHAM AND DURHAM COUNTIES UNTIL 315 AM EST
